source.title: MIBI or IHC 1X PBS wash buffer

source.description:
Use the same 1 L Nalgene Bottle, if before expiring date. Replace by a new 1 L Nalgene bottle on monthly basis
Use single use 50 mL tube for measurement
Use the measurement marks on the bottle to complete with water
Do not use any other vessels than single use graduated plastic containers to prevent cross contamination

source.description:
Label name (Brady label 0.5", M21-500-7425, Font 14 pts bold, format: Banner landscape)
First line: MIBI or IHC 1X PBS wash buffer
Second line: Exp.: MM/DD/YY (Expiring date, 1 month from the present date)

Add the stock solution
of TBS IHC Wash Buffer with Tween 20 (Cell Marque, 20x)
Make some small aliquots by distributing 1 mL with a 10 mL serological pipette in 1.5 or 2 mL tubes and stock aliquots of 10 mL in 15 mL tubes

Make a 3% (volume/volume) of normal Horse serum
Add
Normal Horse Serum (Vector labs, S-2000) in
of Antibody diluent preparation buffer (1xTBS-Tween) in 50 mL tube
FIlter with a 50 mL syringe (Fisher Scientific, 13-689-8) and filter (Millipore, Millex-HV, SLHV033RS) into a new 50 tube
Label cap tubes using dot printed labels Antibody Diluent (NHS 3%)
Store at -20˚C small aliquots in the staining box reagents and stock aliquots in the specified location

source.description:
Store at 4˚C
Reuse the same Nalgene bottle to make new 1x PBS wash buffer until the initial expiring date (<1 month)

Complete to
with UltraPure Water (Invitrogen, 10977-015)

Warm up the gelatin stock bottle at
prior use to reduce viscosity

Take gelatin by aspirating ~
using a large opening pipette tip >4 mm OD
Add slowly the viscous solution to the tube until it weigh
Put a 15 mL tube on a precision balance and tare it to zero

Take
of warm Ultrapure Water (Invitrogen, 10977-015) and add into the gelatin 15 mL
Make sure that all the gelatin is dissolved and complete the volume to
Make small aliquots by distributing ~1 mL with a 10 mL serological pipette in 1.5 or 2 mL tubes
Store at -20˚C small aliquots in the staining box reagents

using a large opening pipette tip >4 mm OD

of Ultrapure Water (Invitrogen, 10977-015) to a
tube

of sodium azide

tube

Prepare antibody diluent preparation buffer (1xTBS-Tween)
Add
UltraPure Water (Invitrogen, 10977-015) in a Nalgene filter unit (Fisher Scientific, 09-740-28E)
Filter under vacuum
Label as Antibody diluent preparation buffer (1xTBS-Tween)
Use a new 1 L Nalgene bottle

Add 900 mL of ultrapure (type 1, >18 MOhms) water in 1 L Nalgene bottle
Use the measurement marks on the bottle
Do not use any other vessel to measure the water

Weight the following chemicals:
For 1 L add:
NaCl

source.body: Make sure that the chemical used correspond to the formula, particularly, for the sodium phosphate dibasic heptahydrate

source.description: Mix thoroughly. Do not adjust pH
Filter using 2 x 500 mL vacuum filter unit (Fisher Scientific, 09-740-28C)

Label each bottles with Brady lab printer (font 14, bold, banner landscape, tape 1/2") as:
First line: PBS low barium 10x stock
Second line: Date (MM/DD/YY)

Use a new 1 L Nalgene bottle, label with Brady lab printer (font 14pt, bold, banner landscape, 1/2" tape) as follow:
First line: 100 mM TRIS BUFFER pH8.5
Second line: Exp.: MM/DD/YY (expiration date: add 1 month to the preparation date in a new bottle)

Add 900 mL of ultrapure (type 1, >18 MOhms) water in 1 L Nalgene bottle
Use the measurement marks on the bottle
Do not use any other vessel to measure the water
Add 12.114 g of Tris Base
Mix thoroughly
Adjust to 1000 mL with ultrapure (type 1, >18 MOhms) water
Add 3.0 mL of Hydrochloric acid (Sigma-Aldrich, H1758-100ML) and mix well
Calibrate pH meter
Press Calibrate on the pH meter
Wash the pH probe with ultrapure (type 1, >18 MOhms) water, wipe, submerge in buffer 1 (pH 10) and Press Read
Wait until it stabilizes and says second buffer
Wash the pH probe with ultrapure (type 1, >18 MOhms) water, wipe, submerge in buffer 2 (pH 7) and Press Read
If the calibration is successful, the screen should indicate CALIBRATED
Adjust to pH 8.5
Wash the pH probe with ultrapure (type 1, >18 MOhms), wipe, submerge in the Tris solution
Press read and wait for the reading to stabilize
Acceptable pH values range between 8.4 to 8.6, if pH value is in that range, the solution is ready
If the pH is above 8.6 add 100 µL of HCl

If HCl has been added measure the pH again
Reuse the same Nalgene bottle to make new Tris Buffer pH 8.5 100mM until the initial expiring date (<1 month)

Use a new 1 L Nalgene bottle, label with Brady lab printer (font 14pt, bold, banner landscape, 1/2" tape) as follow:
First line: PBS low barium 1x
Second line: Exp.: MM/DD/YY (expiration date: add 1 month to the preparation date in a new bottle)

Add 900 mL of ultrapure (type 1, >18 MOhms) water in 1 L Nalgene bottle
Use the measurement marks on the bottle
Do not use any other vessel to measure the water

Use 50 mL disposable Falcon tube to measure
(2x50 mL) of PBS 10x Low Barium stock solution
Mix thoroughly
Reuse the same Nalgene bottle to make new PBS low Barium until the initial expiring date (<1 month)

Warm up
Ultrapure Water (Invitrogen, 10977-015) in a 50 mL

description: These protocols are designed to prepare solutions to be used for the Multiplex Ion Beam Imaging Time of Flight instrument (MIBI_TOF) and IHC related protocols in the Bendall and Angelo labs. Particularly, the IHC protocol uses the same reagents and steps used for MIBI staining. Therefore, It can be used to validate the compatibility of a new target antibody before use for MIBI staining. These protocols have been successfully use for MIBI and are the result of extensive optimization experiments.
